summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the proposed nolle prosequi (dismissal) for two former prison guards, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas. They were charged with falsifying Bureau of Prisons records the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide. The email states both defendants have successfully completed their deferred prosecution agreements, which included community service and cooperation with an investigation.

keyFacts: Two Bureau of Prisons guards, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, were charged with falsifying records on the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

Their cases were resolved through deferred prosecution agreements requiring six months of good behavior, cooperation with a DOJ Office of the Inspector General investigation, and 100 hours of community service.
As of November 2021, both defendants had complied with their agreements, making a dismissal (nolle prosequi) of their charges appropriate.
The document is internal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the procedural step of dismissing the cases.
